radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases demonstrate dependent atelectasis without pleural effusion. No pericardial effusion is seen. No acute abnormalities are detected in the liver, gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, or visualized portions of the ureters. The spleen is absent. No abnormalities are detected of the stomach, small bowel, or appendix. Central abdominal vasculature appears patent and normal in caliber with an IVC filter and a left external iliac venous stent, as seen previously. There is no ascites. Anterior abdominal wall hernia repair with mesh is again noted. Scattered diverticula are noted in the colon. There is mild wall thickening of the sigmoid colon with adjacent fat stranding and fascial thickening in a region of diverticula. There are adjacent foci of extraluminal air without organized collection compatible with perforation. No acute bony abnormality is detected.
